headline: Jimmy Dean Breakfast Casserole
description: This breakfast casserole with bread, sausage, eggs, cheese, tomatoes, mushrooms, and onion is a hearty, all-in-one breakfast dish that's easy to make.
name: Jimmy Dean Breakfast Casserole
recipeIngredient: 1 (16 ounce) package Regular Flavor Jimmy Dean Pork Sausage

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
Cook sausage in a large skillet over medium-high heat, stirring frequently, until thoroughly cooked and no longer pink, 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from heat.
Combine eggs, milk, dry mustard, and salt in a large bowl; stir well.

Distribute 1/2 of the bread evenly into the prepared dish. Sprinkle with 1/2 of the sausage, 1/2 of the cheese, 1/2 of the tomato, 1/2 of the mushroom, 1/2 of the green onion, and 1/2 of the black pepper. Repeat layers one more time. Pour egg mixture evenly over casserole.
Bake uncovered until eggs are set, 55 to 60 minutes. Tent with foil if the top begins to brown too quickly.

review.reviewBody: I make this all the time & my family loves it! We leave out the veggies & use just the 3 main ingredients. It's our "go to" for lazy weekends & for those days after late night getogethers, such as New Year's Day. Highly recommend!

I use this recipe as base. Usually for a “clean out the fridge “ casserole . Great to have on hand for weekday quick snacks, meals. Microwaves well. It’s the best breakfast casserole I’ve ever made. The secret is to use approx 10 slices of bread . Cut them - then tear them smaller . Also, use the hand mixer for the eggs and milk ( or half and half ) so that it’s more easily absorbed by the bread , while you let it set OVERNIGHT in the fridge. DO NOT OVERCOOK . Mine took maybe 30 mins . WATCH IT and you’ll have a dense , but light custardy egg bake. Turkey bacon also holds up well to this recipe. This last time I used that, sautéed crimini w/ onion, threw in spinach, and for cheese I tore up pepper Jack slices . The layering can be random but put most of the bread in the bottom . With tge layering competed , make sure all of the bread is pressed into the egg mixture and refrigerate. YUMMY!!!!

I've made this recipe every single year on Christmas morning (and my mother did when I was young). It's a family favorite and special tradition. I make it according to the recipe, but also add white onions. I omit the optional mushrooms and tomatoes. I recommend using a firmer bread; my choice being sourdough, but French bread is good too.

We’ve made this recipe for Christmas Eve breakfast for years. Everyone loves it. We use hot sausage and grands biscuits as the bread. We don’t add any extras. I make it the night before and wake up early to pop it in the oven. There’s no way my family would be okay with skipping this.

I'm giving it a 5 because it was very tasty as is. I made no adjustments and everyone ate every bit of it! I made it again because I like to meal prep and this time made it with shredded hashbrowns. It was still a very good recipe. Next time I will add two more eggs. But the recipe on its own is really good and you have to let it cook because the center takes a really long time to cook.
It’s wonderful and most of the ladies in our group wanted the recipe.

I made this exactly as written and opted to add in tomatoes and green onions. Really tasty and easy to make. I will make again! Some reported soggy bread, took too long to cook, etc. I did not experience this but I did use good quality bread with some density to it, not regular sandwich bread. That may make a difference.
So easy to make and a huge hit at Easter brunch!
LOVED IT!! I added 1 medium sweet/Vidalia onion, finely shredded. Also, 1/2 lb of bacon with the sausage. I've done this with both sour dough and Italian breads.
Good recipe, I used 1lbs of sausage with a smoked sausage cut into pieces with a can of rotel. Turned out great.
delicious! I make this recipe in muffin cups for individual ready to go breakfast. reheat for 10 minutes and yum!

Great! Easy recipe and very tasty. I halved the recipe for two people and still had plenty left for the next day. I’m not real found of the texture of mushrooms so I chopped them a little finer and I added 1/2 of a 4 oz can of chopped mild green chilies for added flavor. For making half of the recipe place in 8”x8” buttered glass pan and bake at 325 degrees for 25-30 minutes. Enjoy!

I've made this twice now and followed directions to a T. Came out wonderful. I fried a small onion with the sausage the 2nd time and added 1/2 cp chpd grn pepper. I am making this again on a cold Sun morn, substituting ham. Best recipe ever and so versatile! It keeps well throughout the wk as well. Thank you for posting.
Awesome. I didn't have the tomato, green onions or tomato but it was still good.
Best dish ever. I added provolone, Italian, and sharp cheddar cheese, mushrooms, red and yellow peppers. My children did not even notice the extra vegetables. They all loved this dish.
My family requests this every holiday! It’s awesome!
Not a fan of mustard powder, so I used garlic powder. Great addition to the recipe.
quick and easy
Great would like the receipt for jimmy dean breakfast caderole
I made it with homemade Italian bread and fiesta cheese. No tomato or mushroom. It was fantastic! Will make again!

3 cups of Vit D WHOLE milk
7 slices of oven-toasted whole-grain white Bunny Bread cubed 
use convection bake setting
bakes up to 55 minutes- do not brown the sides/underneath

Easy, straightforward recipe. It really comes down to if you want a breakfast casserole filled with bread or potatoes. I added the optional mushrooms to the sausage while it was still in the skillet, so they cooked a bit before going into the casserole dish. Plenty of flavor thanks to the sausage, but I recommend keeping a good hot sauce handy to add some kick after serving up.
Family favorite in my house, Gone in one meal. No leftovers.
This is a great recipe where you use bread as the foundation of the casserole. I have used Pillsbury Rolls before and that was great also!
Removed the onions and peppers because it made it too watery. Replaced bread with tater tots. Reduced milk from 3 cups to 2 cups and added two more eggs. Family favorite every time we have guests.
Cut ingredients in half and used a number 8 cast iron. Took 50 minutes. Turned out great.
I substituted hash browns for the bread. Turned out great!

I made mine the night before which was so nice and easy for in the morning. I had too much liquid but maybe it was the fact that I used skim milk. It could use a little more flavor but overall it was good and pretty easy.

I make this with a package of frozen O’Brien potatoes instead of bread. I assemble the night before and bake off in the morning. Takes 15 minutes more because it is cold. I take it to work often. They love it.

Make several of these for a houseboat vacation with the guys. Altered each with adding jalapeños for a spicy flavor, one by the recipe and, one added bacon and maple flavored breakfast sausage. Everyone totally enjoyed. An easy meal to feed a group of people. No leftovers.
will definitely do again
It turned out great! I just added tomatoes, onion powder, and a little paprika.
I added onion rather than peppers and shredded hash browns. I also mixed it all up and cooked it with foil then browned the top afterwards. Also no mustard or tomatoes. It was great!
Loved it! So moist. Not dry like others I've had. Will definitely make this again. May add some of the optional ingredients next time just to try. : )

The whole kitchen smells delicious and we can’t wait to dig in. I lessened the milk by half a cup and added the same quantity of ricotta cheese. I think it’s creamier and even more delicious, if that’s even possible!

Made this for friends Christmas brunch. I adjusted only a little because I didn’t think it was enough sausage. I had some cubed ham so I added that. Everyone loved it. It did take about 1 1/2 hours to bake but I planned ahead after reading the reviews.
I used diced ham instead of sausage and it was very good. Would make again.
I cut up sausage patties that I already had on hand. Quick to put together and then just bake. Will make again!

This is my go to dish whenever I host a brunch at my house. I love it because you can prepare it the night before, put in the fridge uncooked, and bake it the next door an hour before your guests arrive. I make a few changes to make this amazing. I use 11 eggs, 1 16oz package of regular sausage and an 8 oz package of hot sausage. I add 1 can of diced green chiles, and 1 medium seeded tomoatoe. Super easy and delicious. Just make sure to make extra copies of the recipe because you will be asked for it after your guests taste this dish. P.S. It makes amazing leftovers too. I am eating a piece as I type this. :)
I did not make any changes to it. I followed the recipe as the instructions indicated. I am definitely make it again. The ladies at work loved it!
The recipe was simple and the taste was delicious. Next time I would probably add some diced and de-seeded jalapeños just spice it up slightly.
The recipe was simple and the taste was delicious. Next time I would probably add some diced and de-seeded jalapeños just spice it up slightly.
I didn’t add any mustard or tomatoes or mushrooms and it was still delicious!
It was too greasy for my family, they didn’t really eat it so it sat in the fridge for a while then got chucked out.
I made it and we ate it, and it was a hit!! Pretty much followed the recipe. Used hot or spicy sausage. Even the wimps liked it

Made it as-is, not a fan. However, sort of made it again. Used a bag of Jimmy Dean Skillets, poured that (still frozen) into a greased, glass casserole dish, 8x11. Covered with 5 beaten eggs and 1 cup milk. Baked 350 until done which happened to be 40 mins. Even easier.
Added green pepper and diced tomatoes. Have made this casserole multiple times. It's my go to recipe. Always a hit!

I made this exactly as directed (I used tomatoes that I seeded and drained well on paper towels, green peppers and green onions)and stuck in the refrigerator overnight. I raised the oven temperature to 340 for the first 30-35 minutes then cut it back to 325 because a lot of people said it didn't set up right. This was very good-BUT it does need more sausage and cheese. Just my preference. I will make this again
I make this once a month for church breakfast, and it's a huge hit! So easy to prepare the day before too
Really easy to make. Bought fresh bengals and made breakfast sandwiches to freeze for the family during the week.
very good! Easy breakfast for a large group.
Excellent! We top with chopped tomatoes, sour cream, and green onions. SO TASTY!
This was really good. I made it the night before with the maple sausage and used the cut bread. It is light and not heavy like some of the breakfast casseroles tend to be.
I made this for a morning breakfast after guests slept over. It is way too bready. My husband said it wasnt great and I saw a guest cover her portion with a napkin. Not making this again.

Just made this and I really like it. I made it exactly as written (except I left out the optional veggies) and I will make this again. The flavor was really good and it was pretty easy to put together. If you're not much of a meat lover, I would suggest using half the amount of sausage. :)

I made this as a last minute quick brunch when visitors announced they were in town, and would stop by. It came out great - even without being able to allow any time for the egg-milk mixture to really soak into the bread before baking! I used extra cheese to top it, but did wait to top it off with the cheese until the last 15 minutes of bake time. The cheese topping was still nice and gooey that way - not in any way overcooked and rubbery. I will definitely serve this delicious brunch casserole again!
Make sure you don't put in too many veggies as additional veggies will make the cooking time extend quite a lot. Overall great recipe!

Recipe turned out pretty good. I halved the recipe to make a smaller casserole in a 9x9 dish. I cooked the Jimmy Dean maple sausage for this dish. It added a nice flavor. I added green bell peppers to the optional veggie list and kept out the mushrooms. As far as the bread, I cubed a braided loaf of brioche bread. My husband and toddler loved this dish and it’s been added to the keeper list.

I made this recipe twice over the holidays, for two separate, large get-together (one for work, one for family)—it was a hit at both parties! Notes: I substituted 6-8 cups frozen hash browns (thawed) for the bread; I used a dozen eggs (instead of ten); I substituted 1/2 cup half-and-half for 1/2 cup milk (next time, I’ll substitute 1 cup for 1 cup). I also froze one casserole, while I made the other the night before. The frozen casserole was more watery, but I drained it off before serving and it did not seem to significantly effect the flavor. I served with cinnamon rolls and banana bread. Delicious!
So easy & so good. I always make the night before. Great with or without any optional additions. Have even made for a weeknight dinner.
I make this every Christmas morning. I prepare it the night before and use a can of rotel instead of mushrooms or other veg. Gives it a nice spice!!
Very good -- used turkey sausage in lieu of Jimmy Dean -my family thought it was delicious -- no leftovers !!

Prepared this casserole when I had all the family home for a visit. I added sliced zucchini which is always good with egg. Everyone loved it! It is my new favorite breakfast recipe. I was glad it did not require overnight in the refrigerator since there was no extra space in there. 
There was some leftover, so the following day, I reheated it in the oven, and it tasted even better! Delicious recipe!!
It turned out a bit soggy. Next time I will try using 2 cups of milk. I added 1/2 cup sliced mushrooms, 1 diced red pepper and more cheddar cheese.
Very tasty, good recipe, thanks.

I've been making this for several years. The reason for refrigerating overnight is to give the egg-milk mixture a chance to soak the bread... it seems to meld it. I sometimes make it in 2 pans and freeze one (already baked). Let it warm enough to cut into servings (or freeze in servings) and nuke it for about a minute. Salsa or sliced tomatoes make a nice side. I find 12 eggs and another 1/2 cup of half and half work well when dividing into 2 pans. Be careful with the salt if you're using sharp cheddar.
Great recipe, got rave reviews at work breakfast!! I made it the night before and baked it before I left for work. I omitted the mushrooms in mine. Yummy!!
delicious! I added onion and garlic to the sausage.
Family loved it. I used Texas toast bread and omitted the tsp of salt. I ended up cooking it 15 mins more than indicated, but the extra time was not a big deal. Will make again!

I had some leftovers from a party and wanted to use them and found this casserole was a great way to use some buns and chopped broccoli. I'm glad I didn't read reviews and prepared the recipe as is. It turned out perfect. I did not refrigerate ahead of time so I have to wonder if that impacts the reviews of those saying it was too wet. I baked for 55 min using 10 eggs and 3 cups whole milk, but no tomatoes or peppers. I used the broccoli instead. The family loved it. The only minor change was that I finished up a bag of cheese which added about 1/2 cup. Saving to favorites and will be made again. Thanks!

03.12.17 ~ I needed to make a breakfast casserole with ingredients I had on hand. This fit the bill, and it is delicious. I especially like that it is the type of casserole you can make the night before. I opted to use the diced tomatoes, and yellow onion, but skipped the mushrooms. It bake up and served beautifully. We are a Sunday brunch casserole family - and this is a great one.
This makes the best breakfast casserole I've ever had. However, four cups of bread is plenty of bread for a perfect combination.
I used 12 slices of cubed bread with crusts removed, cut the milk to 2 cups and added about 1/2 cup of sour cream. It turned out great.
Delicious and easy! We added some vegetables to spice it up a little.

I reduced the recipe for 6 and added frozen potatoes o'brien to the ingredients. I also added Fox Point seasoning by Penzeys Spices, plus chopped fresh chives. My guests had second helpings; therefore, there weren't any leftovers! I will definitely make this recipe again. Very easy recipe and great flavor!
I added green onions, mushroom and green peppers. Will make this again!
Lovely recipe! First time I made it, all I had was cooked bacon, so I replaced it for the sausage. Turned out fantastic! Thanks for the great recipe!

Made this with left over roasted vegetables, and a chopped tomato as extras, and cut the cheese amount in half. Choose the bread carefully, because it will make a difference in the flavor of your casserole. I used what I always have in the house, which is sprouted bread. This is a keeper in our home.

Thanks for posting.
Delicious! I followed the recipe and it was amazing. The whole family liked it!
yummyyy

I cut the recipe in half - there's only two of us and there was still enough left over for 2 more servings. It was wonderful. Cut back a little on the milk - used 1.25 cups instead of 1.5 since others said theirs was soggy and sautéed red bell pepper and onion with the sausage. Baked for 50 minutes - not soggy at all. We are nearly at sea level though so that might have had an effect. My husband didn't think he was going to like it so I was surprised when he said "yeah, you can make this again, I'll eat it" From him, that was a big compliment - he's pickier than a five year old when it comes to what he'll eat.
This tasted fantastic. I made half with spinach and half with diced tomatoes.

I don't eat pork so I used chicken sausage instead. I did add the mushrooms and green onions. I prepared it the afternoon before and left it in the fridge so all I had to do was pop it in the oven the next morning. It was delicious.
I would recommend this recipe to anyone.delicous

I made this for the first time this morning and it wasn't a breeze. Took me about 45 minutes to get it in the oven - I made it exactly as the recipe says and it took an hour to cook (could have cooked for another 15 minutes easily. It tasted a bit bland. My husband liked it but he covers it in tabasco so he thought it had lots of flavor. If I ever do this again I will add more onions, green peppers, cayenne, more salt and I'll use Jimmy Dean Hot sausage.

I love this recipe. I have made it for colleagues and they continually ask me for the recipe. I always add small amounts of 'various' optional additions to this recipe. 

It has become a 'special' occasion brunch recipe for me.

I've been making this casserole for about 12 years for Christmas morning. Most of the time I half the recipe since the portions are huge and we only have three people. I switch the sausage for ham and I usually end up cooking it 1.5 to 2 hours since it seems to be runny still if I cook it for the time stated in the recipe. All in all it's a great recipe that my family keeps coming back to year after year
Yum! Easy! Family loved it.

I followed this recipe very closely, with the exception of cooking one small onion and a red bell pepper in with the sausage and adding some ground black pepper to the egg mixture. 

In my opinion this was just an okay dish. It did set up and was not soggy but it was very bland.

I made no changes. I didn't add the optional ingredients. I happened to have english muffin bread onhand. Almost any bread would work well I think. It cooked perfectly . Very good. My company loved it! I served it with fruit. It reminds me of a strata. I will make this again. It would make a great base too. Next time I want to use Diced ham, green peppers and onions, like a Denver omelette .
made it the way the recipe called for it was a hit with the family.yes I will make again.

I have made this for years and it is a pretty foolproof recipe and always tastes great . The person who taught me this recipe years ago also spread a layer of Campbells condensed cream of mushroom soup (right out the can) on the top of the last layer before sprinkling with cheese. Sounds a little wierd but adds moisture and a little depth to the flavor. This seems to be a good substitute for people who do not like whole sliced mushrooms which some reecipes call for.
Loved this casserole, will definitely make it again!

Added fresh green onion, sweet peppers and sweet onion. Forgot pepper but those ingredients alone made the taste superb. My husband didn't like the bread and truthful neither did I. I cooked it for an hour and the middle was still soggy like. Not sure if I used to many eggs and milk but this recipe is something I won't be running to try again. I will stick to my own breakfast casserole as potatoes work better in my opinion.

Perfect for breakfast and even better for leftovers! I ended up buying the maple flavor of jimmy dean sausage and it adds such a good flavor! I also decreased the milk by a cup since it seemed like it was too much. I also bought hashbrowns frozen and there are options with onions and red and green peppers and I have opted for that for more flavor! Thank you for sharing this recipe and I will be making this time and time again!!

I've tried many breakfast casseroles and this was the first one that didn't shrink to half it's size when I removed it from the oven. It "fell" a little, but still stayed nice and fluffy. I didn't add any of the optional ingredients since I have picky eaters, but everyone loved it. I think the secret is the layering. This is my "go to" morning casserole now for sure!

I made this for a brunch potluck and it was a hit! I got so many compliments about how tasty it was. I made some modifications:

I used 12 eggs, 2 pillsbury crescent rolls, 4 slices of bread cubed, green onions, and 1 can of mushroom pieces. Everything else was the same. I layered the bottom with one crescent roll tube followed by half the ingredients. Then I repeated the layer with the second crescent roll followed by the cubed bread. If I were to do it again, I would probably put the cubed bread beneath the second layer of crescent rolls so that they don't stick out as much. The very top layer was cheese.

I made this overnight and left in the fridge. Then, I baked it the next morning and it was fine! I didn't have to pre-bake the crescent rolls either. Will definitely be making this again!
Enjoyed the recipe but will make slight modifications next time as it's a little soggy. Less egg & milk. Possibly use tater tots or hash browns.

Well my daughter's 8th grade class loved the casserole and they are picky teenagers. I followed the recipe according to a teenager's requirements: eggs, cheddar cheese, sausage, bread and a little spice. However, I used cubed Sourdough and Italian bread combined. The sourdough was day old, very day old actually. I did not experience the soggy center as some reviewers did but did cook it for 60 to 70 minutes. There were NO leftovers. I did make it the night before.
